● Cash flow to Housing Authority: $657,587 every year
Step 3: Pay the Developer Fairly
Developer Payment Structure:
● The developer gets 8% of construction costs as their fee
● Half paid during construction
● Half paid when construction is complete
● For the affordable apartments, if everything goes perfectly, they get an extra 4% bonus
Why This Matters:
● Professional developers need to be paid fairly
● This structure aligns their interests with ours
● They only get full payment if the project succeeds

We create three separate companies:
1. Master Entity - Owned by Mobile Housing Authority

○ Owns the two development companies below
○ Receives profits from home sales
○ Makes business decisions about using those profits
2. Workforce Housing Company

○ Builds and sells the 120 homes
○ Uses Mortgage Revenue Bonds (for homeownership)
○ Completely separate from the apartment company
○ Sends profits to Master Entity
3. Affordable Housing Company

○ Builds and owns the 80 apartments
○ Uses Multifamily Housing Bonds (for rentals)
○ Receives investment from Master Entity
○ Operates independently
